intro: Tenoria rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf tenoria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of rounded, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
